title: Factor the Perfect Square
text: Does the expression match any of these formats: $${\left(a x\right)}^2+2a b x$$ + $$b^2$$ $$=$$ $${\left(a x+b\right)}^2$$, $${\left(a x\right)}^2-2a b x+b^2$$ $$=$$ $${\left(a x-b\right)}^2$$ ? Yes.

title: Factor the Perfect Square
text: In this case, we can see that $$25n^2+20n+4$$ as $${\left(a x\right)}^2+2a b x+b^2={\left(ax+b\right)}^2$$ where $$ax=5n$$ and $$b=2$$. We can factor $$25n^2+20n+4$$ as $${\left(5n+2\right)}^2$$.

title: Use Square Root Property
text: The square root property: if $$x^2$$ $$=$$ k, then $$x$$ $$=$$ $$\sqrt{k}$$, or $$x$$ $$=$$ $$-\sqrt{k}$$, or $$x$$ $$=\sqrt{k}$$. $${\left(5n+2\right)}^2=18$$, we can take square root both sides and get $$5n+2=\sqrt{18}$$ and $$5n+2=-\sqrt{18}$$.

title: Solve for $$n$$ in $$5n+2=\sqrt{18}$$
text: What is $$n$$ when $$5n+2=-\sqrt{18}$$? Simplify the square root as much as possible.

title: Solve for $$n$$ in $$5n+2=-\sqrt{18}$$
text: What is $$n$$ when $$5n+2=\sqrt{18}$$? Simplify the square root as much as possible.

title: Final Answer
text: Therefore, $$25n^2+20n+4=18$$ has two solutions which are $$n=\frac{2}{5}+\frac{3}{5} \sqrt{2}$$ and $$n=\frac{2}{5}-\frac{3}{5} \sqrt{2}$$.
